title: How to Fix Xbox 360 Problems

steps.headline: If you have one bar for the red ring it means something is up with the cable connecting to your router on the back of your Xbox.
Change the router and your one bar ring will leave you alone.
If you have two rings then it's something to do with the disk you are playing on.
The disk may have a laser burn or something like that.
steps.description: Get it fixed or buy a new one.

steps.headline: Four rings is no different.
steps.description: It just means the wire connecting your Xbox the the socket in the wall is damaged or unplugged. Make sure it is plugged all the way in. Otherwise, buy a new wall socket if yours is damaged.

steps.headline: The final is the most scary.
steps.description: The Three Red Rings. This means your Xbox 360 has overheated and is now damaged unless you get it fixed. There have been rumors of methods that do work. The ones that don't will be under the "Warnings" section.

steps.headline: Place a damp towel over the Xbox and leave it for 48 hours.
steps.description: This happens to be the only one that works.

text: If you have one bar for the red ring it means something is up with the cable connecting to your router on the back of your Xbox.  Change the router and your one bar ring will leave you alone.  If you have two rings then it's something to do with the disk you are playing on.  The disk may have a laser burn or something like that. Get it fixed or buy a new one. Four rings is no different. It just means the wire connecting your Xbox the the socket in the wall is damaged or unplugged. Make sure it is plugged all the way in. Otherwise, buy a new wall socket if yours is damaged. The final is the most scary. The Three Red Rings. This means your Xbox 360 has overheated and is now damaged unless you get it fixed. There have been rumors of methods that do work. The ones that don't will be under the "Warnings" section. Place a damp towel over the Xbox and leave it for 48 hours. This happens to be the only one that works.
